page.title: 01Landscape
page.content: The area surrounds the rural outskirts of the rural town of Gillingham. It is also situated on the Rivers Stour and Lodden which divide the area. In this part of Dorset the low lying land forms a clay basin as opposed to the chalk downs of nearby Wiltshire. Situated on the edge of the Blackmore Vale,the area is part of the North Dorset District which itself extends across 255 square miles from central Dorset, to the northern boundaries with Wiltshire and Somerset. Nearby Gillingham station is on the Waterloo to Exeter railway line.
